results.title: Le Corbeau = the Raven
results.brief_description:
A small French village is plagued by a poison pen writer, whose principal target is the town doctor. The vitriolic letters wreak so much havoc that soon neighbour turns upon neighbour. Eventually, the doctor himself is suspected of writing the letters, cloaking himself in the respectability of his office. When the psychiatrist starts receiving letters as well, he decides to investigate. Concluding that his own wife is the culprit, he has her committed. But soon after, more letters arrive … ‘Le Corbeau’ is a realistic portrait of Occupied France and its obsession for petty bickering and vengeful denunciation. Produced by the German production company ‘Continental Films’ the film was condemned as unpatriotic after the Liberation, and director Henri-Georges Clouzot was banned from filmmaking until 1947. Le Corbeau’ was remade in Hollywood by Otto Preminger as ‘The 13th Letter’ (1951).

Credits: Producer: Rene Montis ; director: Henri-Georges Clouzot ; writers, Henri-Georges Clouzot, Louis Chavance ; photography, Nicolas Hayer ; music, Tony Aubin ; sound, William-Robert Sivel.
Cast: Pierre Fresnay, Micheline Francey, Ginette Leclerc, Roger Blin, Jeanne Fusier-Gir, Pierre Bertin, Pierre Larquey, Jean Brochard, Helene Manson, Noel Roquevert, Louis Seigner, Sylvie.

results.title: Le Ciel Est Bleu = the Sky Is Blue
results.brief_description:
A former war correspondant is given a new assignement as a sports journalist and sent to Dublin to cover a rugby match. While on assignment he meets a former American girlfiend and rekindles their affair.

Credits: Director, Serge Leroy ; writers, Serge Leroy, Myriam Lempereur ; photography, Jean-Jacques Rochut ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Frederic de Pasquale, Alexandra Stewart, Harry Brogan, Brian McGrath, Larbi Essakali, Liam O’Callaghan, Grace O’Shaughnessy.

results.title: Le Chevalier de Pardaillan
results.creator_credit: Bernard Borderie, Andre Haguet and Andre Legrand
results.brief_description:
In 1588, the Duke de Guise and princess Fausta are vying for the crown. Violetta, a young gypsy who has caught the duke’s eyes, is the object of a merciless competition between would-be lovers. When the duke discovers Violetta is of noble origins, he has her kidnapped in order to help in his attempt to overthrow the king. Pardaillan must then intervene to save the king and the damsel in distress.

Credits: Producers, Andre Legrand, Andre Haguet ; director, Bernard Borderie ; writers, Henri Haguet, Bernard Borderie ; photography, Henri Persin ; music, Paul Misraki ; costumes, Rosine Delamare.
Cast: Gerard Barray, Jean Topart, Gianna-Maria Canale, Michele Grellier, Guy Delorme.

results.title: Le Chant du Depart
results.brief_description:
Every Wednesday the members of the ‘lonely heart’ club gather in a private house. They have decided to commit a collective suicide, but at the last minute a voice shouts “No” and the story starts on a new basis: a society where men and women are living in perfect happiness …

Credits: Director, Pascal Aubier ; writer, Pascal Aubier ; photography, Jean-Jacques Flori ; music, Daniel Duval, Horacio Vaggione, Elisabeth Wiener.
Cast: Brigitte Fossey, Rufus, Germaine Montero, Michel de Re, Paulette Frantz, Jacques Rispal.

results.title: Le Cadeau
results.brief_description: An animated film in which a little man after many unsuccessful attempts manages to make a trumpet emit the appropriate sound. This film won first prize for animation at the Westdeutsche Kurzfilmtage and first prize at Cork International Film Festival. Animation by Michel Altermatt and Rene Guillaume. No narration, music only.

results.title: Le Bourgeois Gentilhomme = the Would-Be Gentleman
results.brief_description:
Monsieur Jourdain is a vulgar nouveau-riche attempting to buy his way into the uppermost rings of society.

Credits: Director, Roger Coggio ; writers, Roger Coggio, Bernard G. Landry ; photography, Claude Lecomte ; music, Jean Bouchety ; choreography, Claude Bessy.
Cast: Rosy Varte, Roger Coggio, Ludmila Mikael, Michel Galabru, Jean-Pierre Darras, Robert Manuel, Etienne Chicot.

results.title: Le Bonheur = Happiness
results.brief_description:
Anarchist Philippe Lutcher vows to kill anyone who represents ‘the establishment’. He ends up shooting idolised music-hall singer Clara Stuart in full view of her audience. The singer escapes death and the two get to know each other, eventually falling in love. At the trial, Clara offers to testify in favour of Philippe, but he refuses, determined to become a martyr to his cause.

Credits: Director, Marcel L’Herbier ; photography, Harry Stradling ; music, Billy Colson ; technical collaboration, Jean Dreville.
Cast: Gaby Morlay, Charles Boyer, Paulette Dubost, Michel Simon, Jean Toulout.

results.title: Le Bois des Amants = Lovers' Grove
results.brief_description:
During WWII, Herta von Stauffen travels to Normandy with a fake Ausweiss and a borrowed uniform to be with her husband for Christmas. She is billeted at Madame Parisot’s whose son, Charles, has joined the British army.

Credits: Producer, Ray Ventura ; director, Claude Autant-Lara ; writers, Albert Husson, Rene Hardy, Jacques Remy ; photography, Jacques Natteau ; music, Rene Cloerec ; art direction, Max Douy.
Cast: Laurent Terzieff, Erika Remberg, Francoise Rosay, Horst Franck, Gert Froebe, Francoise Rosay.

results.title: Lazy Sunday afternoon
results.brief_description: In the desert a vulture enjoys the silence of a hot afternoon. The sudden appearance of a vehicle destroys the quiet of the day. Two pistoleros exit the car ready for a duel; our hero, the vulture, watches as the pistoleros take part in a very funny slow motion shoot-out.
